metadata.title: CVE-2016-4000 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Jython before 2.7.1rc1 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code via acrafted serialized PyFunction object.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4000` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jython - 2.5.3-9ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jython package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.3-9ubuntu0.1').
